alert.note: Alert for Dale; Henry; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 2:05AM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Dale, southern Henry, northeastern Houston and southwestern Early Counties through 345 AM EDT/245 AM CDT/... At 305 AM EDT/205 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Headland, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Headland, Blakely, Dothan, Kinsey, Ashford, Cowarts, Webb, Columbia, Grimes, Avon, Newville, Napier Field, Gordon, Haleburg, Saffold, Pansey, Tumbleton, Kirkland Crossroads, Sigma and Grandberry Crossroads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
